svg.style: background: #ffffff; background-color: light-dark(#ffffff, #121212); color-scheme: light dark;

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 25px; margin-left: 269px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ededed); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

ellipse.style: fill: light-dark(rgb(106, 0, 255), rgb(255, 167, 255)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(55, 0, 204), rgb(239, 192, 255));

path.style: stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255)); animation: 500ms linear 0s infinite normal none running ge-flow-animation-mMFlcYZNAHTTsWgzFRv1; stroke-dashoffset: 16;
fill: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));
stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255)); animation: 500ms linear 0s infinite normal none running ge-flow-animation-mMFlcYZNAHTTsWgzFRv1; stroke-dashoffset: 16;
fill: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 236px; height: 1px; padding-top: 275px; margin-left: 272px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 305px; margin-left: 277px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 26px; overflow: hidden; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: 1. MAC address is represent in Hex

switch.text: 1. MAC address is represent in Hex

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 350px; margin-left: 277px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 56px; overflow: hidden; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: 2. MAC address contains of 6 blocks, each of 1 byte. total 6 * 8 = 48bits. Each block of MAC address can sperated by colons, hyphens and dots

switch.text: 2. MAC address contains of 6 blocks, e...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 415px; margin-left: 277px;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
3. Typically assigned by the manufacturer and burned into the hardware, though it can sometimes be changed via software.
IEEE allocates to manufacturer from pool

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 485px; margin-left: 277px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 66px; overflow: hidden; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
4. In MAC address, First 3 bytes are
company ID (OUI), and Last 3 bytes are
network device ID

switch.text: 4. In MAC address, First 3 bytes are...

path.style: fill: light-dark(rgb(250, 104, 0), rgb(233, 107, 18)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(199, 53, 0), rgb(255, 145, 100));

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 308px; height: 1px; padding-top: 673px; margin-left: 1px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center; color: #000000;

div.div: Why do we need MAC, when we have IP address

switch.text: Why do we need MAC, when we have IP address

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 300px; height: 1px; padding-top: 738px; margin-left: 6px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 96px; overflow: hidden; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: 1. Even though IPs are unique to every network interface in that LAN, IP cannot directly interact with hardware Because The system is designed in such a way that it separates the "Software/Logic" (IP)(Networking Layer) from the "Hardware/Physical" (MAC)(Data-Link layer)

switch.text: 1. Even though IPs are unique to every network int...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 300px; height: 1px; padding-top: 808px; margin-left: 6px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: 2. The NIC (hardware) uses the MAC address to decide whether it should accept the Ethernet frame

switch.text: 2. The NIC (hardware) uses the MAC address to deci...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 300px; height: 1px; padding-top: 863px; margin-left: 6px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 66px; overflow: hidden; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: 3. Incase of ARP, When the NIC passes ethernet frame to the OS, then the OS/Software uses the MAC address to identify the interface that has the target IP address and sends the new ARP reply

switch.text: 3. Incase of ARP, When the NIC passes ethernet fra...
